original: Loos, Viggo, redaktör, fil. dr, Norrköping, f. 12/5/95 i Malmö. G. 19 m. Anna Maria Heintze. — Stud:ex. i Lund, fil. kand., fil. lic. o. fil. dr v. Sthlms högsk. Föret, flera utr. res., bl. a. som statsstip. t. Engl. 22 o. som Pubhkl. stip. t. Ital. 35. Medarb. i Skånetidn. Dagen 16, red:sekr. där, red :sekr. i Norrköp. Tidn. 20, andre red. där sed. 34. Led. av styr. f. Ö^stg. konstfören., ordf. i Norrköp. konstgille. Medl. av Publ :kl. o. Sv. journ:-fören., ordf. i Ö. Sv:es pressfören. 34-39. Skr.: Carl Skånberg, hans liv o. verk (28, ,ny uppl. 47), Kulturteater-provinsteater (33), Stilväxlingar i 1800-talets måleri (akad. avh. 37), Tinto-retto, motreformationens målare (40), Friluftsmåleriets genombrott i sv. konst (Sv. allm. konstfören. publ. 45), diktsaml. Sign.: V. L.
translated: Loos, Viggo, editor, PhD, Norrköping, b. 12/5/95 in Malmö. Married 19 with Anna Maria Heintze. — Studied: graduated from Lund, Bachelor of Arts, Licentiate of Philosophy, and Doctor of Philosophy from Stockholm University. Undertook several foreign trips, including as a government scholar to England in 1922 and as a Publishing Academy scholar to Italy in 1935. Collaborator in Skånetidn. Dagen from 1916, secretary there, then secretary of Norrköp. Tidn. from 1920, and later associate editor since 1934. Member of the board of Ö^stg. Art Association, chairman of Norrköp. Art Guild. Member of the Publishing Club and the Swedish Journalists Association, chairman of the Eastern Sweden Press Association from 1934-1939. Wrote: Carl Skånberg, his life and work (1928, new edition 1947), Cultural Theater-Provincial Theater (1933), Style changes in 19th-century painting (doctoral thesis 1937), Tintoretto, painter of the Counter-Reformation (1940), The breakthrough of outdoor painting in Swedish art (Swedish General Art Association publication 1945), poetry collection, signed: V. L..
